head.title: Schedule of Bond Offerings for This Week

hedline.hl1: Schedule of Bond Offerings for This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to tomorrow's auction of three- and six-month bills.

By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 6.07 percent and a six-month bill was 6.03 percent. Markets were closed on Monday for the Labor Day holiday.
The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to tomorrow's auction of three- and six-month bills.

By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 6.07 percent and a six-month bill was 6.03 percent. Markets were closed on Monday for the Labor Day holiday.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
AES Corp., $600 million of senior notes due in 2010. Ba1/BB/---. Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's Corp./Duff & Phelps Credit.
Austin, Tex., $52.9 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
New Jersey Housing, $79.6 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
Chicago Skyway, $150 million of senior bonds. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Connecticut Housing Finance Authority, $125 million of debt securities. PaineWebber Inc.
New York State Dormitory Authority, $107 million of debt securities for St. Catherine of Sienna. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
North Slope Borough, Alaska, $96.7 million of debt securities. George K. Baum & Co.
